meta.description: Why widely-used PFAS coatings found on objects like frying pans and raincoats are in the spotlight.

title: The race to replace persistent chemicals in our homes
cleaned_text: Shari Franjevic is the programme manager for GreenScreen, which certifies products as free of PFAS and other chemicals. "In countries where PFAS-free products are allowed, for use at airports, for example, the products are being purchased and users are satisfied with the performance, e.g. London Heathrow," Ms Franjevic says.

opengraph.article:author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
opengraph.description: Why widely-used PFAS coatings found on objects like frying pans and raincoats are in the spotlight.
opengraph.title: The race to replace persistent chemicals in our homes
